articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Hamas leaders held a second day of truce talks with Egyptian and Qatari mediators on Sunday, with no apparent progress reported as the Islamist group maintained its demand that any agreement must end the war in Gaza, Palestinian officials said.
articles.title: Gaza ceasefire talks continue in Cairo, Israel pounds the Palestinian enclave

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's cabinet decided on Sunday to shut down Al Jazeera's operations in Israel for as long as the war in Gaza continues, on the grounds the Qatari television network threatens national security.
articles.title: Israeli cabinet votes to shut down Al Jazeera's local operations

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The Palestinian Islamist group Hamas on Sunday claimed responsibility for an attack on the Kerem Shalom crossing between Israel and Gaza that local media reports said resulted in Israeli casuatlies.
articles.title: Hamas claims responsibility for attack on Israel-Gaza border crossing, casualties reported

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu hardened his rejection of Hamas demands for an end to the Gaza war in exchange for the freeing of hostages, saying on Sunday that would keep the Palestinian Islamist group in power and pose a threat to Israel.
articles.title: Netanyahu says ending Gaza war now would keep Hamas in power

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: An Israeli airstrike killed four members of a family in a house in a border village in southern Lebanon on Sunday, civil defence and security sources said.
articles.title: Four Lebanese civilians killed in Israeli strike on border village

articles.author: Dan Peleschuk
articles.description: Ukrainians in the embattled east flocked to church on Sunday to mark their third wartime Easter as Russian troops inched closer to threatening some of the region's key cities.
articles.title: Ukrainians in embattled east mark third Easter under fire

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The number of people killed by flooding and other impacts of the heavy rains battering Kenya has risen to 228, the interior ministry said on Sunday.
articles.title: Death toll from Kenya floods rises to 228

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The death toll from heavy rains that have inundated Brazil's southern state of Rio Grande do Sul has risen to at least 66, local authorities said on Sunday.
articles.title: Death toll from rains in southern Brazil climbs to 66, over 100 still missing

articles.author: John Irish, Ingrid Melander
articles.description: French President Emmanuel Macron will likely urge China's President Xi Jinping, who arrives in Paris on Sunday for a rare visit, to reduce trade imbalances and to use his influence with Russia over the war in Ukraine.
articles.title: France's Macron set to press China's Xi on trade, Ukraine
Fake videos of Modi aides trigger political showdown in India election
